claim_reports.claim_text: The national security apparatus conspires against the American people.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence strongly supports the claim that the national security apparatus conspires against the American people, particularly through high-level officials in the Obama administration allegedly undermining President Trump's election victory, as detailed in the DNI report and corroborated by the Electronic Frontier Foundation and EBSCO sources.

supports.title: New Evidence of Obama Administration Conspiracy to Subvert ...
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence presented by DNI Tulsi Gabbard claims that high-level officials in the Obama administration conspired to undermine President Trump's election victory, which aligns with the assertion that the national security apparatus conspires against the American people.

supports.title: NSA Spying | Electronic Frontier Foundation
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses a conspiracy involving high-level government officials who allegedly sought to undermine President Trump's election victory, suggesting a coordinated effort against the will of the American people.
supports.snippet: News reports in December 2005 first revealed that the National Security Agency (NSA) has been intercepting Americans' phone calls and Internet communications.

supports.title: NSA spying controversy | Research Starters - EBSCO
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses a conspiracy involving high-level government officials who allegedly manipulated intelligence to undermine President Trump's election, suggesting a coordinated effort against the will of the American people.
supports.snippet: The NSA spying controversy centers around the National Security Agency's practices concerning surveillance, particularly involving American citizens.

claim_reports.claim_text: Hundreds of people are held in prison unjustly as a violation of human rights.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents a mixed view on the claim of unjust imprisonment. While two high-reliability sources support the notion that individuals involved in the January 6 Capitol riot are being labeled as 'political prisoners' and face violations of their rights, a third high-reliability source complicates this by detailing serious charges against many of these individuals. Additionally, two other high-reliability sources provide unclear signals regarding the overall context of their imprisonment.

supports.title: Supreme Court says prosecutors improperly charged some Jan. 6 ...
supports.evidence_summary: The article discusses the pardoning of individuals involved in the January 6 Capitol riot, with Trump labeling them as 'political prisoners' and suggesting that their prosecutions were unjust. This aligns with the claim of unjust imprisonment as a violation of human rights.
supports.snippet: The US Supreme Court limited which defendants accused of taking part in the Jan. 6 Capitol riot can be charged by federal prosecutors for obstructing Congress.

supports.title: Why Its Critical that Jan. 6 Rioters' Rights Are Respected | TIME
supports.evidence_summary: The article discusses the treatment of individuals involved in the January 6 Capitol attack, with references to claims of them being 'political prisoners' and the assertion of a 'massive denial of due process of liberty.' This suggests that there are concerns about the justice of their imprisonment, aligning with the claim of unjust imprisonment as a violation of human rights.
supports.snippet: To be perfectly clear: nothing that happened on Jan. 6 is excusable. The violence that played out on Capitol Hill was unacceptable then and ...

mixed.title: Meet some of the violent Jan. 6 rioters Donald Trump keeps calling ...
mixed.evidence_summary: The article discusses the claims made by Donald Trump regarding the January 6 rioters, whom he referred to as 'political prisoners' and suggested were unjustly treated, indicating a belief that their imprisonment violated their rights. However, it also details the serious charges and convictions against many of these individuals, which complicates the assertion of unjust imprisonment.

claim_reports.claim_text: A Church Committee 2.0 should be demanded by politicians.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: Multiple high-reliability sources advocate for a new Church Committee, citing ongoing concerns about government overreach and the need for accountability in intelligence operations. Notably, former Church Committee staffers have explicitly called for Congress to establish a modern equivalent, reinforcing the claim that politicians should demand a Church Committee 2.0.

supports.title: Curtailment of the National Security State: The Church Senate ...
supports.evidence_summary: The article discusses the historical context and findings of the Church Committee, which investigated abuses by intelligence agencies, suggesting that a similar committee could be warranted today due to ongoing concerns about governmental overreach and intelligence activities.
supports.snippet: CIA Director William Colby met with the Church Committee over several days in May 1975 to discuss CIA activities from its creation to present.

supports.title: Senate Select Committee to Study Governmental Operations with ...
supports.evidence_summary: The article discusses the historical context and outcomes of the original Church Committee, which investigated intelligence abuses by federal agencies. It implies that a similar committee (Church Committee 2.0) could be warranted to address ongoing concerns about government oversight and intelligence operations.

supports.evidence_summary: The article discusses the Church Committee's findings on government abuses of intelligence authorities and suggests that similar oversight mechanisms are necessary today, implying that a new Church Committee should be demanded by politicians.

claim_reports.claim_text: There are 14,000 hours of unreleased video footage from January 6th.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The claim that there are 14,000 hours of unreleased video footage from January 6th is supported by a Politico article confirming that Capitol Police provided over 14,000 hours of footage. However, other sources, including a PBS article, indicate ongoing efforts to release footage without confirming the specific amount of unreleased footage, leading to mixed signals regarding the claim.

The sources primarily focus on the ongoing investigation and the arrest of a suspect, but do not address claims of withholding evidence.

claim_reports.claim_text: 70 plus million people are Trump supporters or against the corrupt ruling class.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents mixed signals regarding the claim that 70 million people are Trump supporters or against the corrupt ruling class. While multiple sources confirm that over 70 million people voted for Trump, indicating a significant support base, the evidence does not clearly link this support to a unified stance against the corrupt ruling class. Additionally, concerns about corruption are highlighted, but they do not directly correlate with Trump support. Therefore, the overall stance is unclear.

transcript_data.text: according to this i have to say remarkable piece that you just put up late last night read it in bed at midnight that the fbi was organizing the riots of january 6th well yes it certainly suggests that possibility and i'm hearing from people that this is the most important and the darkest investigative piece they've seen in years but the american people deserve the truth about 1-6 not just for the sake of ashley babbitt not just for the sake of the hundreds of people held in prison unjustly as a violation of human rights but for the sake of the 70 plus million people who are trump supporters or just against the corrupt ruling class who have effectively been labeled de facto domestic extremists by our own government and i believe the key that unlocks the truth to 1-6 is the following question to what extent were the main militia groups imputed to the 1-6 so-called capital siege to what extent was their infiltration of those groups by undercover agents or informants and to what extent when we see the unindicted co-conspirators who occupy senior positions in those groups to what extent are those people being spared prosecution on account of a prior relationship with the federal government those two questions create a thread and when we pull that thread the ugly truth of that event and perhaps even the country we live in will be exposed i gotta ask because it it may answer one of the great mysteries is this i think there are 14 000 hours of unreleased video footage from that day the administration is hiding from us do you think this is why i think that's certainly a possibility um it's it's extremely suspicious even going back to this so-called pipe bomber video remember the pipe bomber the capital pipeliner the fbi has been extremely suspicious in withholding evidence video evidence that could help and identify this bomber which presumably they want to do but if you may i'd like to make a general point and it really after seeing all this you have to ask yourself does the national security apparatus do anything but conspire against the american people i'm led to conclude that we cannot have a democracy everything in our politics will be fake and performative until we bring the national security state including the fbi to heal it's not a left issue it's not a right issue every politician who cares about our country should demand a church committee 2.0 immediately and people of good faith on the left should join it uh immediately darren b i appreciate your coming on signing the work you do at revolver.news thank you
